page.title: 20DECOY MARSH
page.content: {DUCK DECOY} A large area of marshy land which is known a{DECOY MARSH,}lies on the Widnes side of the Lighthouse and contains a structure known as{Hale {Decoy,}which has a pentagonal shape and is surrounded by a moat. It is thought to have been in operation since{1631.} There is a pond in the middle of the pentagonal and to cross the moat a swing bridge is used. The whole of the area is surrounded by a wide belt of trees. Thousands of ducks were lured into it and swam along one of the five curved channels leading to the caged and netted area, killed and then used to supplement the meat supply. Today it is is preserved as an Ancient Monument to protect wild life.
